src: Daugelis jų maisto mums bus pažįstama, tačiau romėnai turėjo ir keistų arba neįprastų pokylių patiekalų, įskaitant šerną, povą, sraiges ir graužiką, vadinamą miegapele Dar vienas skirtumas buvo tai, kad vargšai ir moterys maistą valgė sėdėdami ant kėdžių, o turtingi vyrai mėgo rengti puotas, kurių metu drybsodavo ant šonų valgydami maistą. Senovės romėnų patiekaluose negalėjo būti maisto produktų, atkeliavusių į Europą iš Amerikos ar Azijos vėlesniais amžiais. Pavyzdžiui, jie neturėjo kukurūzų, pomidorų, bulvių, kakavos, joks senovės romėnas net nėra ragavęs kalakuto.
mt: Many of their foods will be familiar to us, but the Romans had some strange or unusual dishes, including boar, peacock, ostrich and rabbit, called dormouse. Another difference was that the poor and women ate sitting on stools, while rich men liked to hold banquets, where they reclined on couches to eat. Ancient Roman dishes could not have included food products that arrived in Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, coffee, no ancient Roman ever roasted peanuts.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Civilizacija – tai konkreti kultūra, būdinga didelei grupei bendrai gyvenančių ir dirbančių žmonių, visuomenė. Žodis civilizacija kilęs iš lotyniško žodžio „civilis“, kuris reiškia civilinį, yra susijęs su lotyniškuoju „civis“, reiškiančiu pilietį, bei „civitas“, reiškiančiu miestą ar miestą-valstybę, ir taip pat kažkaip apibrėžia bendruomenės dydį. Miestai-valstybės yra tautų pirmtakai. Civilizacijos kultūra reiškia žinių perdavimą iš vienos kartos į kartą, tęstinį kultūrinį palikimą ir nemažą sklaidą. Mažosios kultūros ne retai pranyksta nepalikdamos svarių istorinių įrodymų ir nepripažįstamos tikromis civilizacijomis.
mt: Civilization is a specific culture, characteristic of a large group of people living and working together, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin word "civilis", which means civil, is related to the Latin "civis", meaning citizen, and "civitas", meaning city or city-state, and somehow defines the size of the community. City-states are the ancestors of nations. Civilizational culture means the transmission of knowledge from one generation to another, continuous cultural legacy and a large spread. Small cultures often die without leaving significant historical evidence and are not recognized as true civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong yra sugriauta tvirtovė ir budistų vienuolynas Paro rajono viršutinėje dalyje (Phondey kaime). Teigiama, kad 1649 m. šabdrungas Ngavangas Namgijalas sukūrė tvirtovę, minėdamas savo pergalę prieš tibetiečių ir mongolų pajėgas. Po 1951 m. gaisro liko nedaug Drukgyal Dzong reliktų, pvz., Šabdrungo Ngavango Namgijalo atvaizdas. Po gaisro tvirtovė buvo išsaugota ir apsaugota bei išlieka viena iš įspūdingiausių Butano traukos centrų.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro valley (Phodrang village). It is said that in 1649 Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal built the fortress to commemorate his victory over Tibetan and Mongolian forces. After a 1951 fire, little remained of Drukgyal Dzong, such as a portrait of Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected and remains one of the most impressive centers of Bhutanese trekking.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: XVIII a. Kambodža atsidūrė tarp dviejų galingų kaimynių – Tailando ir Vietnamo. Tajai XVIII a. kelis kartus įsiveržė į Kambodžą, o 1772 m. jie sunaikino Pnompenį. Pačiame XVIII amžiaus pabaigoje į Kambodžą įsiveržė ir vietnamiečiai.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was caught between two powerful neighbors – Thailand and Vietnam. Thailand invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century, and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. At the end of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taivanas buvo atrastas XV amžiuje, kai ją aplankė Europos jūreiviai ir pavadino „Ilha Formosa“, kas reiškia „graži sala“. 1624 m. Nyderlandų Rytų Indijos įmonė įkūrė bazę pietvakarių Taivane, pradėdama transformuoti čiabuvių grūdų gamybos praktiką ir įdarbindama Kinijos darbininkų, dirbsiančių jos ryžių bei cukraus plantacijose. Čingų dinastijos (1644–1912) pajėgos 1683 m. perėmė Taivano vakarinės bei šiaurinės pakrančių kontrolę ir 1885 m. paskelbė Taivaną Čingų imperijos provincija. 1895 m. po pralaimėjimo pirmajame Kinijos-Japonijos kare (1894–1895 m.), Čingų vyriausybė pasirašo Šimonesekio sutartį, kuria perleidžia Taivaną Japonijai, valdžiusiai salą iki 1945 m.
mt: Taiwan was discovered in the 15th century, when it was visited by European sailors and named "Ilha Formosa", meaning "beautiful island". In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, beginning the transformation of the aboriginal millet farming practice and hiring Chinese laborers to work its rice and sugar plantations. Qing dynasty (1644–1912) forces took control of Taiwan's western and northern coastlines in 1683 and declared Taiwan a Qing province in 1885. In 1895, after losing the First Sino-Japanese War (1894–1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded Taiwan to Japan, who ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Tai vadinama cheminės medžiagos pH. Indikatorių galima pasigaminti iš raudonųjų kopūstų sulčių. Kopūstų sulčių spalva parodo, kiek medžiaga rūgštinė ar bazinė (šarminė). pH lygį nurodo vandenilio (H raidė santrumpoje pH) jonų kiekis tiriamoje cheminėje medžiagoje. Vandenilio jonai – tai yra protonai, iš kurių yra pašalinti jų elektronai (vandenilio atomą sudaro vienas protonas ir vienas elektronas).
mt: This is called the pH of a chemical substance. Indicators can be made from red cabbage juice. The color of red cabbage juice shows how acidic or basic (colorful) the substance is. The pH level indicates the amount of hydrogen (H in the pH abbreviation) ions in the chemical substance. Hydrogen ions are protons, from which their electrons have been removed (a hydrogen atom consists of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Liūtai yra pačios socialiausios katės, gyvenančios didelėmis grupėmis, vadinamomis būriais. Šeimą sudaro vienas–trys giminystės ryšiais susiję suaugę patinai ir net iki trisdešimt patelių ir jauniklių. Patelės paprastai yra artimai tarpusavyje susijusios – kaip didelė seserų ir dukterų šeima. Liūtų būriai veikia panašiai kaip vilkų arba šunų (labai į liūtus, bet ne į kitas kates, panašūs gyvūnai) gaujos ir taip pat yra negailestingi savo grobiui.
mt: Lynxes are the most social of cats, living in large groups called prides. A family consists of one to three related adult males and up to thirty females and cubs. Females are usually closely related – like a large sisterhood and sisterhood. Lynx prides work similarly to wolves or dogs (very similar to lynxes, but not to other cats, animals) packs and are also ruthless to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Kita grupė – vidutinio dydžio katės, ėdančios vidutinio dydžio grobį nuo triušių iki antilopių ir elnių. Ir paskutinės – mažosios katės (įskaitant laisvėje gyvenančias namines kates), kurios ėda daug įvairesnį grobį, pavyzdžiui, vabzdžius, graužikus, driežus ir paukščius. Jų sėkmės paslaptis yra tinkamos vietos samprata – speciali užduotis, kurią turi atlikti kiekvienas katinas ir kuri neleidžia jam konkuruoti su kitais.
mt: Another group are medium-sized cats, eating medium-sized prey from mice to antelopes and eland. And the last are small cats (including free-ranging domestic cats), which eat a more varied diet, for example, insects, rodents, lizards and birds. Their secret is the right place at the right time – a special task that each cat must perform and which does not allow it to compete with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ocelotai mėgsta ėsti mažus gyvūnus. Jei gali, gaudo beždžiones, gyvates, graužikus ir paukščius. Beveik visi ocelotų medžiojami gyvūnai yra daug mažesni už juos. Mokslininkai mano, kad ocelotai gyvūnus, kuriuos taikosi suėsti (grobį), seka ir atranda pagal kvapą, uosdami žemę, kur jie buvo. Jie labai gerai mato tamsoje, nes turi naktinio matymo gebėjimą, ir juda labai patykomis. Ocelotai medžioja savo grobį, susiliedami su aplinka, tada jį sugriebdami.
mt: Ocelots like to eat small animals. If they can, they hunt rabbits, rodents, and birds. Almost all of the ocelot's prey are much smaller than it. Scientists believe that ocelots hunt prey by scent, marking the ground where they were. They are very good at seeing in the dark, because they have night vision, and they move very quietly. Ocelots hunt their prey, blending into the environment, then pouncing on it.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Tigras, stambaus sudėjimo atletiškas gyvūnas, moka kopti (nors ne idealiai), plaukti, gali nušuoliuoti tolimus atstumus ir turi penkiskart didesnę traukimo jėgą nei stiprus žmogus. Tigras priklauso tai pačiai grupei (Genus Panthera) kaip liūtai, leopardai ir jaguarai. Tik šios keturios katės gali riaumoti. Tigro riaumojimas neprilygsta griausmingam liūto riaumojimui. Jis panašesnis į garsiai urzgiant iššaukiamą sakinį.
mt: The tiger, an athletic animal of large size, can climb (though not ideally), swim, jump long distances, and has five times the pulling strength of a strong man. The tiger belongs to the same genus (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. Only these four cats can roar. Tiger roaring is not comparable to the frightening roar of a lion. It is more like the well-known phrase "roar of the crowd."
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Ląstelė yra mažiausias gyvo (daiktų) organizmo struktūrinis ir funkcinis vienetas. Žodis „ląstelė“ kilęs iš lotyniškojo „cella“, kuris reiškia mažą kambarį. Jei pažiūrėsite į gyvus padarus pro mikroskopą, pamatysite, kad jie sudaryti iš mažų kvadratėlių ar kamuoliukų. Robertas Hukas, Anglijos biologas, per mikroskopą kamštyje pamatė mažus kvadratėlius. Jos atrodė kaip kambariai. Jis buvo pirmasis stebėjęs negyvas ląsteles.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living organism. The word cell comes from the Latin cellula, meaning "small room". If you look at living cells through a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or spheres. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, looked at cells through a microscope. They looked like little rooms. He was the first person to see dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Gyvūnai sudaryti iš daugybės ląstelių. Jie ėda ir virškina maistą. Dauguma gyvūnų juda. Smegenis turi tik gyvūnai (nors net ne visi gyvūnai, pavyzdžiui, medūzos smegenų neturi). Žemėje gyvūnus galima rasti visur. Jie gyvena po žeme, plaukioja vandenynuose ir skraido danguje.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat and digest food. Most animals move. Brains are only found in animals (not all animals, for example, jellyfish do not have brains). Animals can be found everywhere on Earth. They live underground, swim in the oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Augalai gamina deguonį, kuriuo kvėpuoja žmonės, ir jis yra anglies dioksido dalis, kurį žmonės iškvepia. Augalai pasigamina maisto iš saulės per fotosintezės procesą. Taip pat jie teikia pavėsį. Mes statome savo namus iš augalų ir gaminame drabužius iš augalų. Daugelis maisto produktų, kuriuos valgome, yra augalai. Be augalų negalėtų išgyventi gyvūnai.
mt: Plants produce oxygen, which we breathe, and it is part of carbon dioxide, which we exhale. Plants get their food from the sun through the process of photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build our homes from plants and make clothes from plants. Many of the food products we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Kai maža gyvų būtybių grupė (maža populiacija) atsiskiria nuo pagrindinės populiacijos, kuriai priklausė (pvz., kerta kalnų masyvą, perplaukia upę arba persikelia į naują salą ir negali lengvai sugrįžti), ji dažnai atsiduria aplinkoje, kuri skiriasi nuo tos, kurioje jie gyveno anksčiau. Šioje naujoje aplinkoje yra kitokių išteklių ir konkurentų, todėl, kad nauja populiacija būtų stipri konkurentė, jai reikės kitokių ypatybių ar pasikeitimų, nei anksčiau. Pradinė populiacija visiškai nepasikeitė, jiems vis tiek reikia tokio paties prisitaikymo. Laikui bėgant, naujajai populiacijai pradėjus prisitaikyti prie naujos aplinkos, ji pradeda atrodyti vis mažiau panašesnė į kitas populiacijas. Galiausiai, po tūkstančių ar netgi milijonų metų dvi populiacijos atrodys taip skirtingai, kad jos negalės būti priskiriamos tai pačiai rūšiai. Mes šį procesą vadiname naujų rūšių formavimusi. Naujų rūšių formavimasis yra neišvengiama pasekmė ir labai svarbi evoliucijos dalis.
mt: When a small group of animals (small population) separates from the main population (e.g., crosses a mountain range, swims across a river, or migrates to a new island and cannot easily return), it often ends up in an environment that differs from that in which it lived before. In this new environment there are different resources and competitors, so that the new population would be a strong competitor, it needs different characteristics or changes than before. The original population has not changed at all, they still need the same adaptation. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to the new environment, it begins to look less and less like other populations. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, two populations will look so different that they cannot be assigned to the same species. We call this process the formation of new species. The formation of new species is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Kai maža gyvų būtybių grupė (maža populiacija) atsiskiria nuo pagrindinės populiacijos, kuriai priklausė (pvz., kerta kalnų masyvą, perplaukia upę arba persikelia į naują salą ir negali lengvai sugrįžti), ji dažnai atsiduria aplinkoje, kuri skiriasi nuo tos, kurioje jie gyveno anksčiau. Šioje naujoje aplinkoje yra kitokių išteklių ir konkurentų, todėl, kad nauja populiacija būtų stipri konkurentė, jai reikės kitokių ypatybių ar pasikeitimų, nei anksčiau. src: Pagrindinis kraujotakos organas yra širdis; ji pumpuoja kraują. Kraujas iš širdies teka kraujagyslėmis, vadinamomis arterijomis, o į širdį grįžta kraujagyslėmis, vadinamomis venomis. Smulkiausios kraujagyslės vadinamos kapiliarais.
mt: The heart is the main circulatory organ; it pumps blood. Blood flows through arteries, which are called veins, and returns to the heart through veins, which are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Pagrindinis kraujotakos organas yra širdis; ji pumpuoja kraują. Kraujas iš širdies teka kraujagyslėmis, vadinamomis arterijomis, o į širdį grįžta kraujagyslėmis, vadinamomis venomis. Smulkiausios kraujagyslės vadinamos kapiliarais.

src: Vabzdžiai buvo pirmieji gyvūnai, patekę į orą. Jų gebėjimas skristi padėjo jiems lengviau išvengti priešų ir efektyviau rasti maistą bei draugus. Daugelio vabzdžių pranašumas – jie gali lenkti sparnus atgal išilgai savo kūno. Tai leidžia jiems nuo plėšrūnų pasislėpti daugelyje mažų vietų. Šiandien vieninteliai vabzdžiai, negalintys suskleisti savo sparnų, yra laumžirgiai ir lašalai.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helped them avoid predators and find food and mates more effectively. One advantage of many insects is that they can fold their wings back along their body. This allows them to hide in many small places. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings are dragonflies and damselflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Daugelis šiuolaikinių paleontologų mano, kad viena dinozaurų grupė išgyveno ir tebegyvena. Vadiname juos paukščiais. Daugelis žmonių nelaiko juos dinozaurais, nes jie turi plunksnas ir skraido. Bet paukščiai vis dar išsaugojo daug panašumų su dinozaurais. Jų pėdos buvo su žvynais ir nagais, jie dėjo kiaušinius ir vaikščiojo ant dviejų užpakalinių kojų kaip tiranozaurai.
mt: Most modern paleontologists believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and still survives. We call them birds. Many people do not consider them dinosaurs because they have feathers and fly. But birds still retain many similarities with dinosaurs. Their feet were covered with scales and claws, they laid eggs and walked on two hind legs like tyrannosaurs.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Trieratopso dantys galėjo susmulkinti ne tik lapus, bet ir labai kietas šakas bei šaknis. Kai kurių mokslininkų manymu, triceratopsai ėdė cikūnus – tokius augalus, kurie buvo paplitę kreidos periodu. Šie augalai panašūs į mažą palmę su aštrių, dygių lapų vainiku. Galbūt triceratopsas naudojo savo galingą snapą, kad nuskintų visus lapus prieš ėsdamas kamieną. Kiti mokslininkai tvirtina, kad šie augalai yra labai nuodingi, todėl mažai tikėtina, kad kuris nors dinozauras juos ėdė, nors šiandien tinginys ir kiti gyvūnai, pavyzdžiui, papūga (dinozaurų palikuonis), gali ėsti nuodingus lapus ar vaisius.
mt: Trieratops teeth may have been able to shred not only leaves, but also very tough branches and roots. Some scientists believe that triceratopses ate cycads – plants that were common during the Cretaceous period. These plants are similar to a small palm with a ring of sharp, pointed leaves. Perhaps the triceratops used its powerful beak to shred all the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists claim that these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, although today, the giraffe (a dinosaur relative) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Italijos nacionalinė futbolo komanda yra antra sėkmingiausiai žaidžianti komanda pasaulyje, po Vokietijos nacionalinės futbolo komandos, ir tapo 2006 m. FIFA pasaulio čempionato nugalėtoja. Populiarios sporto šakos: futbolas, krepšinis, tinklinis, vandensvydis, fechtavimasis, regbis, dviračių sportas, ledo ritulys, riedučių ritulys ir F1 automobilių lenktynės. Žiemos sportas yra populiariausias Šiaurės regionuose – italai dalyvauja tarptautinėse varžybose ir olimpinėse žaidynėse.
mt: Italy's national football team is the second most successful team in the world, after Germany's national football team, and became the 2006 FIFA World Cup champion. Popular sports: football, basketball, volleyball, swimming, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, curling and F1 car racing. Winter sports are most popular in the North – Italians participate in international competitions and the Olympics.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Liuksemburgas turi ilgą istoriją, bet nepriklausomas jis tapo 1839 m. Dabartinės Belgijos dalys praeityje priklausė Liuksemburgui, bet po XIX a. 4-ąjį dešimtmetį vykusios Belgijos revoliucijos jos tapo Belgijos. Liuksemburgas visada stengėsi išlikti neutralia šalimi, tačiau tiek per Pirmąjį pasaulinį karą, tiek per Antrąjį pasaulinį karą jį okupavo Vokietija. 1957 m. Liuksemburgas tapo organizacijos, kuri šiandien vadinama Europos Sąjunga, įkūrėju.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but it became independent in 1839. Parts of modern Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but after the 19th century fourth decade, the Belgian Revolution, they became part of Belgium. Luxembourg has always strived to remain a neutral country, but both during World War I and World War II it was occupied by Germany. In 1957, Luxembourg became one of the founding members of the organization that is now called the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Europinė Turkijos dalis (rytų Trakija arba Rumelija Balkanų pusiasalyje) apima 3 % šalies. Turkijos teritorija yra didesnio nei 1 600 kilometrų ilgio (1 000 mylių) ir 800 km (500 mylių) pločio, netaisyklingo stačiakampio formos. Turkijos teritorija su ežerais užima 783 562 kvadratinius kilometrus (300 948 kv. myl.), iš kurių 755 688 kvadratiniai kilometrai (291 773 kv. myl.) yra pietvakarių Azijoje, o 23 764 kvadratiniai kilometrai (9 174 kv. myl.) – Europoje. Pagal plotą Turkija yra 37-oji didžiausia pasaulio šalis ir yra maždaug tokio dydžio, kaip Prancūzijos metropolinė zona ir Jungtinė Karalystė kartu sudėjus. Turkiją net iš trijų pusių supa jūros: Egėjo vakaruose, Juodoji šiaurėje ir Viduržemio pietuose.
mt: The European part of Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula) comprises 3% of the country. Turkey's territory is a larger than 1,600 km (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, irregular rectangle. Turkey's territory with lakes covers 783,562 km² (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 km² (291,773 sq mi) are in southwestern Asia, and 23,764 km² (9,174 sq mi) are in Europe. By area, Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world and is about the size of France's metropolitan area and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Vatikano mieste yra apie 800 gyventojų. Tai yra mažiausia nepriklausoma valstybė pasaulyje, turinti mažiausiai gyventojų. Vatikano teisės aktuose ir oficialiuose pranešimuose vartojama italų kalba. Italų k. taip pat yra kalba, kurią kasdien vartoja didžioji dalis valstybėjes darbuotojų, o lotynų k. dažnai vartojama religinėse apeigose. Visi Vatikano gyventojai yra Romos katalikai.
mt: Vatican City has a population of about 800. It is the smallest independent state in the world, with the fewest inhabitants. Italian is used in the Vatican's legal documents and official communications. Italian is also the language most commonly spoken by the majority of the state's workers, and Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All residents of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

Italian is used in the Vatican's legal documents and official communications. Italian is also the language most commonly spoken by the majority of the state's workers, and Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All residents of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Šiandien naudojant kompiuterius apdorojamos nuotraukos ir vaizdo įrašai. Įmantrios animacijos gali būti sukurtos naudojant kompiuterius ir šis animacijos tipas vis dažniau naudojamas televizijoje ir filmuose. Muzika dažnai įrašoma naudojant sudėtingesnius kompiuterius, kad būtų galima apdoroti ir maišyti garsus.
mt: Today computers are used to process images and video. Complex animations can be created using computers and this type of animation is increasingly used in television and movies. Music is often recorded using more complex computers to process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Harapos ir Mohendžo Daro miestuose beveik kiekvienuose namuose buvo tualetas su nuleidžiamu vandeniu, prijungtas prie įmantrios nuotekų sistemos. Nuotekų sistemų liekanų buvo rasta namuose Mino civilizacijos miestuose Kretos ir Santorinio salose Graikijoje. Tualetai jau buvo senovės Egipte, Persijoje ir Kinijoje. Romėnų civilizacijoje tualetai kartais buvo viešųjų pirčių dalis, kur vyrai ir moterys kartu būdavo mišrioje kompanijoje.
mt: In almost every house in Harappa and Mohenjo Daro, there was a toilet with a flush, connected to a sophisticated sewage system. Sewage systems were found in houses in the cities of the Minoan civilization on Crete and Santorini in Greece. Toilets were already in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public baths, where men and women were in mixed company.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Šiuolaikinės pačiūžos ašmenys turi dvi briaunas, tarp kurių yra įgaubtas įdubimas. Dvi briaunos leidžia geriau įsikibti į ledą net ir pasvirus. Kadangi ašmenų apačia yra šiek tiek išlenkta, ašmenims pasvirus į vieną ar kitą pusę, briauna, kuri liečia ledą, taip pat išsilenkia. Tai leidžia čiuožėjui atlikti posūkį. Jei pačiūžos pakreipiamos į dešinę, čiuožėjas suka į dešinę, o jei pačiūžos pakreipiamos į kairę, čiuožėjas suka į kairę.
mt: 21st century ice skates have two blades, with a depression between them. The two blades allow better grip on the ice even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blades is slightly curved, the blade that touches the ice also curves when tilted. This allows the skater to turn. If the ice skates are tilted to the right, the skater turns to the right, and if the ice skates are tilted to the left, the skater turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Kad grįžtų ankstesnis energijos lygis, jie turi atsikratyti papildomos energijos, kurią gavo iš šviesos. Jie tai daro išspinduliuodami mažą šviesos dalelę, vadinamą fotonu. Mokslininkai vadina šį procesą „priverstine šviesos spinduliuote“, nes ryški šviesa stimuliuoja atomus, dėl to šviesos fotonai išspinduliuojami ir šviesa yra spinduliuotės tipas. Kitame paveiksle vaizduojami fotonus spinduliuojantys atomai. Žinoma, realybėje fotonai yra daug mažesni nei paveiksle. Fotonai yra mažesni net už daleles, sudarančias atomus!
mt: To return to previous energy levels, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from light. They do this by emitting a small light particle, called a photon. Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of light," because bright light stimulates atoms to emit photons, and light is a type of emission. In another image, atoms are emitting photons. Of course, in reality, photons are much smaller than in the image. Photons are smaller than the particles that make up atoms!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Po šimtų veikimo valandų kaitinamasis lemputės siūlelis galiausiai sudega ir lemputė nebeveikia. Lemputę tada reikia pakeisti. Keisti lemputę reikia atsargiai. Pirmiausia turite išjungti šviestuvo jungiklį ar atjungti laidą. Tai svarbu todėl, kad lizde, kuriame yra metalinė lemputės dalis, tekanti elektra gali sukelti stiprų elektrošoką, jei paliestumėte vidinę lizdo dalį arba lemputės metalinį pagrindą, kol ji dar bent iš dalies yra lizde.
mt: After hundreds of hours of operation, the heating element in the light bulb finally burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs to be replaced. Replacing the light bulb needs to be done carefully. First, you need to turn off the power supply or disconnect the cord. This is important because the electricity flowing through the socket, where the metal part of the light bulb is, can cause a strong electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the light bulb while it is still at least partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Po šimtų veikimo valandų kaitinamasis lemputės siūlelis galiausiai sudega ir lemputė nebeveikia. Lemputę tada reikia pakeisti. Keisti lemputę reikia atsargiai. src: Branduolinės bombos veikimas pagrįstas principu, kad norint išlaikyti branduolį, kuriame yra daug protonų ir neutronų, reikia daug energijos. Panašiai kaip stumti į kalną sunkų vežimą. Branduolys vėl skyla ir išsilaisvina kažkiek energijos. Kai kurių atomų branduolys nėra stabilus, vadinasi, jie linkę skaidytis esant nedidelei arba visiškai nesant trinties.
mt: The nuclear bomb works on the principle that to keep a nucleus with many protons and neutrons, a lot of energy is needed. Like pushing a heavy truck up a hill. The nucleus splits and releases some energy. Some atomic nuclei are not stable, meaning they are prone to decay with little or no friction.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Kai skambinate kam nors, kas yra už tūkstančių mylių, naudojate palydovinį ryšį. Erdvėje esantis palydovas gauna signalą ir beveik akimirksniu jį grąžina. Palydovą į kosmosą nuskraidino raketa. Mokslininkai kosmose esančius teleskopus naudoja todėl, kad Žemės atmosfera iškreipia dalį šviesos ir vaizdo. Norint paleisti palydovą ar teleskopą į kosmosą, reikalinga milžiniška 100 pėdų (apie 30 metrų) aukščio raketa.
mt: When someone calls you from thousands of miles away, you're using satellite communications. A satellite in space receives a signal and almost instantaneously relays it back. Scientists send telescopes into space because Earth's atmosphere distorts some light and images. To launch a satellite or telescope into space, you need a huge 100-foot (about 30-meter) rocket.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Laikas yra aplink mus ir veikia visas mūsų veiklas, tačiau jį sunku suvokti. Tūkstančius metų laiką tyrinėjo religijos, filosofijos ir mokslo srities tyrinėtojai. Laiką patiriame kaip įvykių sekas, vykstančias iš ateities per dabartį į praeitį. Laiką taip pat galima suprasti pagal tai, kaip palyginame įvykių trukmę (ilgį). Galite patys žymėti praėjusį laiką stebėdami pasikartojančius cikliškus įvykius. Cikliški įvykiai yra vis reguliariai pasikartojantys įvykiai.
mt: Time is around us and acts on all our actions, but it is difficult to understand. For thousands of years, time was studied by religious, philosophical and scientific researchers. We experience time as a sequence of events, occurring from the future through the present to the past. Time can also be understood by how we compare the duration of events (length). You can mark the past by observing recurring cyclic events. Cyclic events are all regularly recurring events.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Pagal tradiciją baigęs mokyką sosto įpėdinis eidavo tiesiai į kariuomenę. Tačiau Čarlzas įstojo į Kembridžo „Trinity“ koledžą, kuriame studijavo antropologiją ir archeologiją, o vėliau – istoriją, įgydamas 2:2 (žemesnįjį antrosios klasės) laipsnį. Čarlzas tapo pirmuoju Britanijos karališkosios šeimos nariu, turinčiu mokslo laipsnį.
mt: By tradition, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to Cambridge's Trinity College, where he studied anthropology and archaeology, and later history, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class) degree. Charles became the first member of the British royal family to have a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Susigrąžinus danų įstatymų galiojimo teritoriją, Anglijoje ilgai vyravo taika. Tačiau 991 m. Etelredui teko atremti vikingų flotilę, didesnę nei prieš šimtmetį puolusio Gutrumo. Šiam laivynui vadovavo norvegas Olafas Trygvassonas, turėjęs ambicijų susigrąžinti savo šalį, kurioje dominavo Danija. Po pradinių karinių nesėkmių Ethelredas galėjo susitarti su Olafu, kuris grįžo į Norvegiją pabandyti atgauti savo karalystę permainingoje kovoje.
mt: When the Danes regained control of their laws, England was at peace for a long time. However, in 991 AD, Ethelred had to repel a Viking fleet larger than the one that had attacked in the previous century. This fleet was led by Norwegian Olaf Tryggvason, who had ambitions to regain his country, which was dominated by Denmark. After initial military failures, Ethelred could negotiate with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to regain his kingdom in a protracted struggle.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: Maždaug XV amžiuje Šiaurės Estijos kultūra patyrė didelę Vokietijos įtaką. Kai kurie vokiečių vienuoliai norėjo Dievą priartinti prie vietinių žmonių, todėl sukūrė pažodinę estų kalbą. Ji buvo pagrįsta vokiška abėcėle, be to, buvo pridėta viena raidė „Õ / õ“. Laikui bėgant daugelis iš vokiečių kalbos pasiskolintų žodžių prigijo. Tada prasidėjo klestėjimo laikotarpis.
mt: 15th century North Estonian culture was greatly influenced by Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local people, so they created a pseudo-Estonian language. It was based on the German alphabet, and one letter, õ, was added. Over time, many words borrowed from German became obsolete. Then the golden age began.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Skaičiavimai, kiek žmonių šneka hindi kalba, skiriasi. Manoma, kad ji yra tarp antros ir ketvirtos dažniausiai pasaulyje vartojamų kalbų. Gimtąja kalba kalbančiųjų skaičius priklauso nuo to, ar įskaičiuojamos labai glaudžiai susijusios tarmės. Skaičiuojama, kad yra maždaug 340–500 milijonų kalbos vartotojų ir 800 milijonų gali tą kalbą suprasti. Hindi ir urdų kalbų žodžiai panašūs, bet skirtingai rašomi; kasdienėmis temomis paprastai abiejų kalbų vartotojai gali tarpusavyje susikalbėti.
mt: Estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi vary. It is generally considered to be the third most spoken language in the world after Mandarin Chinese and English. The number of native speakers is dependent on whether closely related dialects are counted as separate languages. Estimates range from 340–500 million speakers and 800 million speakers who can understand it. Hindi and Urdu are closely related, but written differently; speakers of the two languages can generally communicate with each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Skaičiavimai, kiek žmonių šneka hindi kalba, skiriasi. Manoma, kad ji yra tarp antros ir ketvirtos dažniausiai pasaulyje vartojamų kalbų. Gimtąja kalba kalbančiųjų skaičius priklauso nuo to, ar įskaičiuojamos labai glaudžiai susijusios tarmės. Skaičiuojama, kad yra maždaug 340–500 milijonų kalbos vartotojų ir 800 milijonų gali tą kalbą suprasti. Hindi ir urdų kalbų žodžiai panašūs, bet skirtingai rašomi; kasdienėmis temomis paprastai abiejų kalbų vartotojai gali tarpusavyje susikalbėti.
mt: Estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi vary. It is generally considered to be the third most spoken language in the world after Mandarin Chinese and English. The number of native speakers is dependent on whether closely related dialects are counted as separate languages. Estimates range from 340–500 million speakers and 800 million speakers who can understand it. Hindi and Urdu are closely related, but written differently; speakers of the two languages can generally communicate with each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: „Hangeul“ yra vienintelė sąmoningai sugalvota abėcėlė, kuri plačiai naudojama kasdien. Abėcėlė buvo sudaryta 1444 m., valdant karaliui Sejongui (1418–1450 m.). Karalius Sedžiongas buvo ketvirtasis Džiosono dinastijos karalius; jis yra vienas labiausiai gerbiamų valdovų. Iš pradžių jis pavadino Hangulio alfabetą Hunminjeongeum, tai reiškia „teisingi garsai žmonėms mokyti“.
mt: Hangul is the only known alphabet invented by a single person. The alphabet was created in 1443, under the rule of King Sejong (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth ruler of the Joseon dynasty; he is one of the most popular rulers. He originally named the Hangul alphabet Hunminjeongeum, which means "teaching the people proper sounds".
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Yra daugybė sanskrito atsiradimo teorijų. Pagal vieną iš jų arijai, migravę iš vakarų į Indiją, atnešė savo kalbą. Sanskritas – tai senovinė kalba, panaši Europoje vartotą lotynų kalbą. Žinoma seniausia pasaulyje knyga buvo parašyta sanskrito kalba. Po upanišadų rinkinio sanskritas tiesiog išnyko dėl hierarchijos. Sanskritas yra labai sudėtinga ir turtinga kalba, tapusi daugelio šiuolaikinių Indijos kalbų šaltiniu (kaip ir lotynų kalba, kuri yra tokių Europos kalbų kaip prancūzų ir ispanų k. šaltinis).
mt: There are many theories of Sanskrit's origin. According to one of them, the Aryans, who migrated from the West to India, brought their language. Sanskrit is an ancient language, similar to the Latin language in Europe. The oldest book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the Upanishads collection, Sanskrit simply died out due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has become the source of many modern Indian languages (as Latin is the source of languages such as French and Spanish).
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Kokia jėga mane trauktų Ijo gravitacija? Jei stovėtumėte ant Ijo paviršiaus, svertumėte mažiau nei Žemėje. Asmuo, sveriantis 200 svarų (90 kg) Žemėje, Ijo svertų apie 36 svarus (16 kg). Taigi gravitacija, žinoma, jus traukia mažiau.
mt: What force would pull me toward Ijo's gravity? If you were standing on Ijo's surface, you would weigh less than on Earth. A person weighing 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on Ijo. So, of course, gravity pulls you less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Mėnulio paviršių sudaro akmenys ir dulkės. Išorinis Mėnulio sluoksnis vadinamas pluta. Pluta yra apie 70 km storio artimesnėje ir 100 km storio tolimesnėje pusėse. Ji plonesnė po Mėnulio jūra ir storesnė po aukštumomis. Artimojoje pusėje gali būti daugiau Mėnulio jūrų, nes pluta yra plonesnė. Lavai buvo lengviau pakilti iki paviršiaus.
mt: The Moon's surface is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called regolith. Regolith is about 70 km thick in the near side and 100 km thick in the far side. It is thicker in the highlands and thinner in the maria. There may be more maria in the near side, because regolith is thinner. Craters were easier to form on the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Dauguma žmonių svajoja apie laikus, kai žmonija galės nukeliauti į tolimą žvaigždę, kiti svarsto, kas ten, anapus, treti tiki ateiviais ar kita gyvybės forma, galimai gyvenančia kitoje planetoje. Bet jei taip nutiks, greičiausiai nenutiks labai greitai. Žvaigždės yra taip nutolusios viena nuo kitos, kad tarp žvaigždžių „kaimynių“ driekiasi trilijonai mylių. Gal vieną dieną jūsų proanūkiai stovės ant svetimo pasaulio žemės svarstydami apie savo senovės protėvius?
mt: Most people dream of a time when humanity can travel to a distant star, some ponder what lies beyond, others believe in visitors or other life forms possibly living on another planet. But if that happens, it will likely not happen very soon. Stars are so far apart that the distance between neighboring stars is trillions of miles. Will your great-grandchildren one day stand on the soil of a foreign world pondering their ancestors?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Saulė neturi plutos, ant kurios galima stovėti kaip Žemėje. Visa Saulė yra sudaryta iš dujų, ugnies ir plazmos. Dujos tampa labiau išretėjusios tolstant nuo Saulės centro. Matoma išorinė Saulės dalis yra vadinama fotosfera, tai reiškia „šviesos kamuolys“.
mt: The Sun does not have a surface on which one can stand like on Earth. The whole Sun is made of gases, fire and plasma. Gases become more rarefied as one moves away from the Sun's center. The visible outer part of the Sun is called the photosphere, meaning "light sphere".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Po maždaug trijų tūkstančių metų 1610 m. Italijos astronomas Galilėjas Galilėjus naudodamas teleskopą pastebėjo, kad Venera turi fazes kaip ir Mėnulis. Fazės egzistuoja todėl, kad apšviečiama tik viena Veneros (arba Mėnulio) pusė – ta, kuri atsukta į Saulę. Veneros fazės palaikė Koperniko teoriją, kad planetos sukasi aplink Saulę. O po kelerių metų, 1639 m., anglų astronomas Jeremiah Horrocksas stebėjo Veneros tranzito reiškinį.
mt: 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei using a telescope noticed that Venus has phases like the Moon. Phases exist because only one side of Venus (or the Moon) is illuminated – the side facing the Sun. Venus phases supported Copernicus' theory that planets orbit the Sun. And a few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed the phenomenon of Venus transit.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazonės upė yra antra pagal ilgį ir didžiausia upė Žemėje. Ji neša daugiau nei 8 kartus daugiau vandens nei antroji pagal dydį upė. Amazonė taip pat yra plačiausia, beveik 10 km pločio, upė Žemėje. 20 procentų vandens, iš planetos upių tekančio į vandenynus, išteka iš Amazonės. Pagrindinė Amazonės upė yra 6 387 km (3 980 mylių) ilgio. Ji surenka vandenį iš tūkstančių mažesnių upių.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river in the world. It carries more than eight times as much water as the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world, almost 10 km wide. Twenty percent of the water that flows into the oceans from Earth's rivers comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: 18 procentų venesueliečių yra bedarbiai, o daugumą tų, kurie turi darbą, dirba neoficialiai. Du trečdaliai darbą turinčių venesueliečių dirba paslaugų sektoriuje, kone ketvirtadalis – pramonės sektoriuose, o penktadalis – žemės ūkio sektoriuje. Venesueliečiams svarbi naftos pramonė, nes šalis eksportuotoja daugiau nei importuoja, nors naftos pramonėje dirba tik vienas procentas darbuotojų.
mt: 18 percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who have jobs work in the informal sector. Most of those who have jobs work in the service sector, almost a quarter in the manufacturing sector, and a fifth in the agricultural sector. Oil is important to Venezuela, as it exports more than it imports, though only one percent of workers are employed in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Žvaigždės išskiria šviesą ir šilumą, nes sujungiant (suliejant) vandenilio atomus, kad būtų sudaryti sunkesni elementai, sukuriama energija. Mokslininkai siekia sukurti reaktorių, galintį tokiu pačiu būdu gaminti energiją. Tačiau tai yra itin sunkiai sprendžiama problema, ir pastatytus naudingus sintezės reaktorius pamatysime tik po daugelio metų.
mt: Stars emit light and heat by fusing hydrogen atoms to make heavier elements, releasing energy. Scientists are trying to build a reactor that can do the same thing to make energy. However, this is a very difficult problem, and we will see useful synthesis reactors only after many years.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Cheminiai elementai ir junginiai gali pereiti iš vienos būsenos į kitą nepakisdami. Azoto dujų savybės yra tokios pačios kaip skysto azoto. Skysto būvio tankis yra didesnis, bet molekulės yra tokios pačios. Kitas pavyzdys yra vanduo. Jo junginys sudarytas iš dviejų vandenilio atomų ir vieno deguonies atomo. Jo molekulinė struktūra lieka nepakitusi, nesvarbu, ar tai dujos, skystis, ar kieta medžiaga. Nors jo fizinė būsena gali keistis, cheminė sudėtis išlieka tokia pati.
mt: Chemical elements and compounds can change states without changing. The properties of nitrogen gas are the same as liquid nitrogen. Its density is higher, but the molecules are the same. Another example is water. Its compound is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. Its molecular structure remains unchanged, regardless of whether it is gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state can change, its chemical composition remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Vykstant revoliuciniam karui, iš pradžių trylika valstijų sudarė silpną centrinę vyriausybę (kurios vienintelė dalis buvo Kongresas), remdamosi Konfederacijos straipsniais. Kongresui trūko galios mokesčiams reguliuoti, ir kadangi nebuvo nacionalinės vykdomosios valdžios ar teismų sistemos, jis pasikliovė valstybės valdžios institucijomis, kurios, vykdydamos visus savo veiksmus, dažiausiai nebendradarbiaudavovo. Ji taip pat neturėjo įgaliojimų nepaisyti mokesčių įstatymų ir tarifų tarp valstybių. Kad būtų galima keisti straipsnius, reikėjo vieningo visų valstijų sutikimo, o valstijos centrinę valdžią priėmė taip nerūpestingai, kad jų atstovai dažnai nedalyvavo.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, initially thirteen states formed a weak central government (whose only part was Congress), relying on the Confederation Articles. Congress lacked the power to regulate taxes, and since there was no national executive branch or judicial system, it often clashed with state governments, which, in carrying out all their actions, often failed to cooperate. It also lacked the authority to ignore state laws and tariffs between states. To amend the Articles, required unanimous consent of all states, and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives often failed to attend.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Vykstant revoliuciniam karui, iš pradžių trylika valstijų sudarė silpną centrinę vyriausybę (kurios vienintelė dalis buvo Kongresas), remdamosi Konfederacijos straipsniais. Kongresui trūko galios mokesčiams reguliuoti, ir kadangi nebuvo nacionalinės vykdomosios valdžios ar teismų sistemos, jis pasikliovė valstybės valdžios institucijomis, kurios, vykdydamos visus savo veiksmus, dažiausiai nebendradarbiaudavovo. Ji taip pat neturėjo įgaliojimų nepaisyti mokesčių įstatymų ir tarifų tarp valstybių. Kad būtų galima keisti straipsnius, reikėjo vieningo visų valstijų sutikimo, o valstijos centrinę valdžią priėmė taip nerūpestingai, kad jų atstovai dažnai nedalyvavo.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, initially thirteen states formed a weak central government (whose only part was Congress), relying on the Confederation Articles. Congress lacked the power to regulate taxes, and since there was no national executive branch or judicial system, it often clashed with state governments, which, in carrying out all their actions, often failed to cooperate. It also lacked the authority to ignore state laws and tariffs between states. To amend the Articles, required unanimous consent of all states, and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives often failed to attend.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Jeigu žiūrėjote filmą „Kodas: L.O.B.I.A.I“, galbūt manote, kad kitoje nepriklausomybės deklaracijos pusėje buvo nupieštas lobių žemėlapis. Tačiau tai nėra tiesa. Nors kitoje dokumento pusėje yra kažkas parašyta, tai nėra lobių žemėlapis. Kitoje Nepriklausomybės deklaracijos pusėje buvo užrašas „Originali Nepriklausomybės deklaracija, pasirašyta 1776 m. liepos 4 d.“. Tekstas yra dokumento apačioje, apverstas. Nors niekas tiksliai nežino, kas tai parašė, žinoma, kad egzistavimo pradžioje šis didelis pergamento dokumentas (jo dydis yra 29,75 x 24,5 col.) buvo suvyniotas saugoti. Todėl tikėtina, kad ši pastaba buvo užrašyta tiesiog kaip pavadinimas.
mt: If you watched the movie "National Treasure", you may think that the other side of the Declaration of Independence had a map of the treasure. However, this is not true. Although there is something written on the other side of the document, it is not a map of the treasure. On the other side of the Declaration of Independence was written "Original Declaration of Independence, signed July 4, 1776". The text is at the bottom of the document, upside down. Although no one knows who wrote this, it is known that this large piece of parchment (its size is 29.75 x 24.5 inches) was rolled up to be stored. Therefore, it is likely that this note was written simply as a title.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Vos tapus nepriklausoma valstybe, Singapūro botanikos sodų patirtis padėjo paversti salą atogrąžų miestu sodu. 1981 m. hibridinė orchidėja Vanda Miss Joaquim buvo pasirinkta tautos nacionaline gėle.
mt: 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower of Singapore.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

mt: 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower of Singapore.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Nors piramidės buvo statomos iš akmenų iki Senosios karalystės pabaigos, Gizos piramidės savo dydžiu ir techniniu tobulumu niekada niekas nepranoko. Naujosios karalystės senovės egiptiečiai žavėjosi pirmtakų monumentais, kuriems tuo metu buvo daugiau kaip tūkstantis metų.
mt: While pyramids were built of stone until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in size and technical sophistication by anyone. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom were awed by the monuments of their predecessors, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Kiekvienais metais, kažkur spalio mėnesį, apie 1,5 mln. žoliaėdžių keliauja link pietinių lygumų, kisrdami Maros upę, nuo šiaurinių kalvų slėpdamiesi nuo liūčių. Ir tada maždaug balandžio mėnesį, palijus lietums, atgal į šiaurę per vakarus, vėl kertant Maros upę. Serengečio regione yra Serengečio nacionalinis parkas, Ngorongoro draustinis ir Masvos gyvūnų rezervatas Tanzanijoje bei Masai Maros nacionalinis rezervatas Kenijoje.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south to the Serengeti region of Tanzania and Kenya every year, crossing the Mara River in the Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area, and Masai Mara National Reserve in April.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Kiekvienais metais, kažkur spalio mėnesį, apie 1,5 mln. žoliaėdžių keliauja link pietinių lygumų, kisrdami Maros upę, nuo šiaurinių kalvų slėpdamiesi nuo liūčių. src: Pasibaigus Prancūzijos užkariavimo mūšiui, Vokietija pradėjo ruoštis invazijai į Britanijos salą. Vokietija pavadino operaciją kodiniu pavadinimu „Jūrų liūtas“. Dauguma britų kariuomenės sunkiųjų ginklų ir atsargų buvo prarasta evakuojantis iš Dunkirko, todėl kariuomenė buvo gana silpna. Bet Karališkasis laivynas vis tiek buvo gerokai galingesnis už Vokietijos laivyną („Kriegsmarine“) ir galėjo sunaikinti bet kokią invazijos flotilę, išsiųstą perplaukti Lamanšą. Tačiau labai mažai Karališkojo laivyno laivų bazavosi netoli tikėtinų invazijos maršrutų, nes admirolai bijojo, kad jie bus nuskandinti Vokietijos oro atakos metu.
mt: After the Battle of France, Germany began preparing for an invasion of the British island. Germany called the operation codename "Sea Lion". Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies were lost evacuating from Dunkirk, so the army was quite weak. But the Royal Navy was still much more powerful than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could have sunk any invasion fleet sent across the Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the expected invasion routes, as admirals feared they would be sunk by German air attacks.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Pirmiausia paaiškinkime Italijos planus. Italija daugiausia buvo Vokietijos ir Japonijos „mažuoju broliu“. Jos kariuomenė ir laivynas buvo silpnesni, nors prieš pat prasidedant karui pastatė keturis naujus laivus. Pagrindiniai Italijos tikslai buvo Afrikos šalys. Norint okupuoti šias šalis, jai reikėjo karių išvykimo aikštelės, kad jie galėtų peplaukti Viduržemio jūrą ir įsiveržti į Afriką. Tuo tikslu jiems reikėjo atsikratyti britų bazių ir laivų Egipte. Be šių veiksmų, Italijos kariniams laivams daugiau nieko daryti nereikėjo. Dabar apie Japoniją. Japonija, kaip ir Didžioji Britanija, buvo salų valstybė.
mt: Let's start with Italy's plans. Italy was mostly Germany and Japan's "little brother". Its army and navy were weaker, though it built four new ships just before the war began. Italy's main goals were the African countries. In order to occupy these countries, it needed to have a port from which its troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. To do this, it needed to get rid of the British bases and ships in Egypt. Without these actions, Italy's naval forces would have nothing to do. Now about Japan. Japan, like Great Britain, was an island nation.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: D dienos išsilaipinimų ir tolesnių mūšių metu buvo išlaisvinta Prancūzijos šiaurė, bet pietūs vis dar buvo okupuoti. Tą dalį valdė „Vichy“ prancūzai. Šie prancūzai 1940 m. susitaikė su vokiečiais ir kartu dirbo, užuot kovoję su įsibrovėliais. 1940 m. rugpjūčio 15 d. sąjungininkai įsiveržė į pietinę Prancūziją – invazija buvo pavadinta „Operation Dragoon“. Vos per dvi savaites amerikiečiai ir Laisvosios Prancūzijos pajėgos sugebėjo išlaisvinti Prancūzijos pietinę dalį ir pasuko į Vokietiją.
mt: 2 days of landings and subsequent battles freed Northern France, but the South was still occupied. That part was ruled by the “Vichy” French, who in 1940 allied with the Germans and worked together, instead of fighting the invaders. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded Southern France – the invasion was called “Operation Dragoon”. Within two weeks, the Americans and the Free French forces were able to free Southern France and turned towards Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: Povandeniniai laivai yra tokie laivai, kurie skirti plaukioti po vandeniu ir ten išbūti ilgesnį laikotarpį. Povandeniniai laivai buvo naudojami I pasauliniame kare ir II pasauliniame kare. Tada jie buvo labai lėti ir turėjo ribotą šaudymo atstumą. Karo pradžioje jie daugiausia plaukė vandens paviršiuje, tačiau patobulėjus ir pradėjus tiksliau veikti radarams povandeniniai laivai buvo priversti pasinerti, kad nebūtų pastebėti. Vokiečių povandeniniai laivai buvo vadinami „U Boat“. Vokiečiai povandeninius laivus gerai navigavo ir valdė. Kadangi vokiečiai sėkmingai naudojo povandeninius laivus, po karo jiems neleidžiama turėti jų daug.
mt: Submarines are ships designed to operate underwater and stay submerged for extended periods. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. At the beginning of the war they were very slow and had a limited range. At the beginning of the war they mostly operated on the surface, but as sonar improved and became more accurate submarines were forced to submerge to avoid detection. German submarines were called U Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and controlling submarines. Because the Germans were successful in using submarines after the war they were not allowed to have many.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
